comments.body:
This test/block could be moved at the beginning of the method, then subsequent tests would be:
```
if fw_offline:
  [...]
else:
  [...]
```
I don't follow, `import_failure` and `fw_offline` are explicitly different things. Depending on version of the firewalld python module, we can perform offline firewall transactions.
You're right: when `import_failure` is `True`, `FW_VERSION` could be not `None`. `import_failure` must be checked at the end, nothing needs to be changed here.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +305,309 @@                        installed version (%s) likely too old. Requires firewalld >= 0.2.11" % FW_VERSION)

        if import_failure:
            module.fail_json(
                msg='Python Module not found: firewalld and its python module are required for this module, \
